title: SoC COMM_ST 394-0-20 Communication Studies Research Seminar

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course explores various trajectories and developments in the general area of media, communication and the environment, with a particular focus on the upcoming national, state, and local 2016 elections in relation to concepts such as nature, the environment, and climate change. Students will complete a research project equivalent to a 20-page written paper, as is consistent with the CS 394 requirement. Potential topics include looking at the uses of media and communication by individual candidates in talking about the environment and climate change; how political parties build their media campaigns around environment and climate change; the impact of these eco-media and communication issues on a national, state, or local election, and similar. The instructor will work with each student to develop a topic for research, and the class will also provide an introduction and overview to ways in which environmental concepts can be approached and understood from the perspectives of media and communication studies.
